content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: A stack of whole notes on a grand staff. In the bass clef the notes are A2 and C-sharp 4. In the treble clef the notes are E4 and A4.
A stack of whole notes on a grand staff. In the bass clef the notes are A2 and C4. In the treble clef the notes are E-flat 4 and A4.
A stack of whole notes on a grand staff. In the bass clef the notes are A2 and C-sharp 4. In the treble clef the notes are E-sharp 4 and A4.
A stack of whole notes on a grand staff. In the bass clef the notes are A2 and C4. In the treble clef the notes are E4 and A4.

content.answer: A stack of whole notes on a grand staff. In the bass clef the notes are A2 and C4. In the treble clef the notes are E4 and A4.

unit.text: 3: Music Fundamentals III - Triads and Seventh Chords

topic.text: 3.1: Triad and Chord Qualities (M, m, d, A)

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
